geometry.planar

Class PolylineShape

  • java.lang.Object
    • geometry.planar.PolylineShape
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Area, Shape, java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    PolygonShape, TileShape

    public abstract class PolylineShape
extends java.lang.Object
implements Shape, java.io.Serializable
    Abstract class with functions for shapes, whose borders consist ob straight lines.
    Version:
    $Id: $Id
    Author:
    Alfons Wirtz
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • corner_is_bounded

        public abstract boolean corner_is_bounded(int p_no)
        returns true, if the the shape has no infinite part at this corner
        Parameters:
        p_no - a int.
        Returns:
        a boolean.

      • border_line_count

        public abstract int border_line_count()
        Returns the number of border lines of the shape
        Returns:
        a int.

      • corner

        public abstract Point corner(int p_no)
        Returns the p_no-th corner of this shape for p_no between 0 and border_line_count() - 1. The corners are sorted starting with the smallest y-coordinate in counterclock sense arount the shape. If there are several corners with the smallest y-coordinate, the corner with the smallest x-coordinate comes first. Consecutive corners may be equal.
        Parameters:
        p_no - a int.
        Returns:
        a Point object.

      • turn_90_degree

        public abstract PolylineShape turn_90_degree(int p_factor,
                                             IntPoint p_pole)
        Turns this area by p_factor times 90 degree around p_pole. Turns this shape by p_factor times 90 degree around p_pole.
        Specified by:
        turn_90_degree in interface Area
        Parameters:
        p_factor - a int.
        p_pole - a IntPoint object.
        Returns:
        a Area object.

      • rotate_approx

        public abstract PolylineShape rotate_approx(double p_angle,
                                            FloatPoint p_pole)
        Rotates the area around p_pole by p_angle. The result may be not exact. Rotates this shape around p_pole by p_angle. The result may be not exact.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:

      • bounded_corners

        public Point[] bounded_corners()
        Return all unbounded cornersw of this shape.
        Returns:
        an array of Point objects.

      • corner_approx

        public FloatPoint corner_approx(int p_no)
        Returns an approximation of the p_no-th corner of this shape for p_no between 0 and border_line_count() - 1. If the shape is not bounded at this corner, the coordinates of the result will be set to Integer.MAX_VALUE.
        Parameters:
        p_no - a int.
        Returns:
        a FloatPoint object.

      • corner_approx_arr

        public FloatPoint[] corner_approx_arr()
        Returns an approximation of the all corners of this shape. If the shape is not bounded at a corner, the coordinates will be set to Integer.MAX_VALUE.
        Specified by:
        corner_approx_arr in interface Area
        Returns:
        an array of FloatPoint objects.

      • equals_corner

        public int equals_corner(Point p_point)
        If p_point is equal to a corner of this shape, the number of that corner is returned; -1 otherwise.
        Parameters:
        p_point - a Point object.
        Returns:
        a int.

      • circumference

        public double circumference()
        Returns the cumulative border line length of the shape. If the shape is unbounded, Integer.MAX_VALUE is returned.
        Specified by:
        circumference in interface Shape
        Returns:
        a double.
